meanings.definition: Excessive patriotism and a belief in national superiority.
meanings.sent1: His chauvinism led him to believe his country was the best in the world.
meanings.sent2: Her chauvinism made her always wave the national flag proudly.
meanings.sent3: The dog's chauvinism for his favorite toy was evident as he guarded it fiercely.
meanings.sent4: The chauvinism of the lion in protecting its territory was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The chauvinism of the sports fans was evident in their unwavering support for their team.

meanings.definition: Prejudiced belief in the superiority of one's own gender.
meanings.sent1: Her chauvinism made her think women were always better than men.
meanings.sent2: His chauvinism led him to believe that men were superior in every way.
meanings.sent3: The cat's chauvinism for female owners was clear as it ignored male visitors.
meanings.sent4: The chauvinism of the peacock in displaying its feathers was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The chauvinism of the students towards their own gender caused tension in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Excessive loyalty to a particular group or cause.
meanings.sent1: His chauvinism towards the charity organization knew no bounds.
meanings.sent2: Her chauvinism for the environmental cause made her a dedicated activist.
meanings.sent3: The tree's chauvinism for sunlight led it to grow taller than the others.
meanings.sent4: The chauvinism of the worker bees towards the queen bee ensured the hive's survival.
meanings.sent5: The chauvinism of the fans towards their favorite band was evident in their unwavering support.
